post.description: Creates a new pattern feature.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The version ID of the task.

parameters.name: patternCreateObject
parameters.description: A JSON object containing Name and Pattern of the feature.

201.description: The ID of the created feature.

400.description:
This error can be returned if the request's parameters are incorrect meaning the required parameters are missing, malformed, or too large.

This error can be returned if the request's body is incorrect meaning the JSON is missing, malformed, or too large. 

Specific reasons you can receive this error:

* REGEX pattern is too complex

401.description:
You do not have access. 

Reasons can include:

* invalid, malformed, or empty subscription key
* you are not the owner or collaborator
* invalid order of API calls

get.description: Gets all application version pattern features.
get.operationId: features - Get version pattern feature list

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The version ID of the task.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of entries to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: take
parameters.description: The number of entries to return. Maximum page size is 500. Default is 100.

200.description: A JSON object containing a list of all pattern features.

400.description: This error can be returned if the request's parameters are incorrect meaning the required parameters are missing, malformed, or too large.

401.description:
You do not have access. 

Reasons can include:

* invalid, malformed, or empty subscription key
* you are not the owner or collaborator
* invalid order of API calls

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The version ID of the task.

parameters.name: phraselistCreateObject

Default value for isExchangeable is true.

400.description:

put.description: Updates the pattern, the name and the state of the pattern feature.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: The version ID of the task.

parameters.name: patternId
parameters.description: The ID of the feature to be updated.

parameters.name: patternUpdateObject
parameters.description:
A JSON object with properties of one of the following examples:
```json
{
    "id": 507628,
    "name": "testPattern",
    "pattern": "\b[A-Z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Z0-9.-]+\\.[A-Z]{2,}\b",
    "isActive": true
}
```
```json
{"IsActive":true}
```

This error can be returned if the request's body is incorrect meaning the JSON is missing, malformed, or too large.

    "name": "Eno",

    "isActive": true
}

{"IsActive":true}

400.description:

post.description:
Adds a batch of labeled examples to the specified application. 

The maximum batch size is 100 items. 

If the item has the ExampleId and a value between 0 - 99, the returned result will also include the ExampleId. This is helpful if items have errors. 

Some items can pass while others fail. The returned result will indicate each item's status.

parameters.name: exampleLabelObjectArray
parameters.description: A JSON array containing example labels.

201.description: A string array determining which labels were added successfully.

400.description:
This error can be returned if the request's parameters are incorrect meaning the required parameters are missing, malformed, or too large.

This error can be returned if the request's body is incorrect meaning the JSON is missing, malformed, or too large. 

This error can be returned for several reasons: 

* too many items in batch
* Item(s) includes intent that does not exist
* item(s) include entity that does not exist
* items(s) include prebuilt entity 

Examples of malformed JSON are:

* incorrect use of a comma, for example a comma after the last item in the array
* missing comma between property/value pairs
* incorrect or missing colon between property and value
* entityLabel array is present and has empty item in array {} without property or value

401.description:
You do not have access. 

Reasons can include:

* invalid, malformed, or empty subscription key
* you are not the owner or collaborator
* invalid order of API calls

201.description: The ID of the created Model.

400.description:
This error can be returned if the request's parameters are incorrect meaning the required parameters are missing, malformed, or too large.

This error can be returned if the request's body is incorrect meaning the JSON is missing, malformed, or too large. 

This error can be returned if you are attempting to create a composite entity child when the max child count is exceeded. 

```
  "error": {
    "code": "BadArgument",
    "message": "Number of entity children cannot exceed 10"
  }
```

* invalid, malformed, or empty subscription key

post.description: Adds a list entity to the LUIS app.

parameters.name: closedListModelCreateObject
parameters.description: A model object containing the name and words for the new closed list entity extractor.

201.description: The ID of the created model.

400.description:
This error can be returned if the request's parameters are incorrect meaning the required parameters are missing, malformed, or too large.
  
This error can be returned if the request's body is incorrect meaning the JSON is missing, malformed, or too large. 
  
This error can be returned if you are attempting to create an entity list when the max sublist item count is already exceeded. The total item count across all sublists is 20,000.
 ```
"error": {
  "code": "BadArgument",
  "message": "Closed list mylist cannot have more than 20000 phrases"
}
```
```
   "error": {
      "code": "BadArgument",
      "message": "An application cannot have more than 50 closedlists."
    }
```

post.description:
Sends a training request for a version of a specified LUIS app. 

This POST request initiates a request asynchronously. To determine whether the training request is successful, submit a GET request to get training status.

* **Note**: The application version is not fully trained unless all the models (intents and entities) are trained successfully or are up to date.

To verify training success, get the training status at least once after training is complete.

202.description: This response indicates the initial training status. If the response is Queued, keep polling at the get training status API to check for training completion.

400.description: This response can occur if either of the appId or versionId parameters are incorrect.

401.description:
You do not have access.
Reasons can include:
  • invalid, malformed, or empty subscription key
  • you are not the owner or collaborator
  • invalid order of API calls
  • subscription key doesn't match region

get.description: Gets the training status of all models (intents and entities) for the specified LUIS app. You must call the train API to train the LUIS app before you call this API to get training status.

200.description:
A successful response provides an array of training status details for a LUIS app. Each element in the response array provides training status for a model (intent or entity). 

**Note:** Training status is not provided for prebuilt entities because they are pretrained.

The modelId property corresponds to an intent or entity. To get the name and type of each model, use the models API which has a request URL in this format:

* https://westus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com/luis/api/v2.0/apps/{appId}/versions/{versionId}/models

The details property for each model can contain the following fields:

* statusId :An integer from 0 to 3 that corresponds to the value of the status field.

* status: A string with one of the following values: 

    * Success
    * UpToDate
    * InProgress
    * Fail        

        * If the status is 'Fail', the failureReason property provides the reason for failure.        

* exampleCount: The number of examples used for training. In the case of the None intent or prebuilt domain intents and entities, this number includes examples provided internally by the system as well as examples you added to your LUIS app.

* failureReason: A string that indicates the reason training failed. The value 'FewLabels' means that no labeled examples were provided for training.

* trainingDateTime: A string indicating the time the model was last trained. The value uses the ISO 8601 format for representing times in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time) with a UTC designator ('Z'), for example: '2017-08-10T01:08:34Z

400.description:
This response can occur for any of the following reasons: 

* You need to submit a training request before you request training status. 
* The format of appId is incorrect. 
* The value of appId is incorrect. 
* The value of  versionId is incorrect.

401.description:
You do not have access. 

Reasons can include:

* invalid, malformed, or empty subscription key
* you are not the owner or collaborator
* invalid order of API calls
* subscription key doesn't match region

The request failed because you have not requested to train the application before requesting training status.

    "code": "BadArgument",
    "message": "Number of entity children cannot exceed 10"
  }
